page.title: 15BUS SERVICES IN MITCHELDEAN
page.content: Buses are the only form of public transport in the Mitcheldean area. The main operator is the National Welsh Omnibus Service, who run the Red and White services. Mitcheldean is fortunate in also having its own company, Cottrells Coaches who run other local bus services, as well as coaches for hire. The Red and White services which pass through Mitcheldean are the Gloucester - Cinderford - Lydney service, and the Ross - Cinderford service. Both operate at 2 hourly intervals on weekdays. Cottrells principal service is the Gloucester - Mitcheldean - Drybrook - Ruardean route, on which they use double deck buses. By running at times when there is no Red and White service to Gloucester, their service is a popular one. Cottrells also run buses for Dene Magna School.
